title: Air India aircraft-to-employee ratio declines substantiallyTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Air India aircraft-to-employee ratio declines substantially Published on : Monday, October 12, 2015
National carrier Air India has achieved a substantial decrease in its aircraft-to-employee ratio in the financial year ended 31st March 2015. The employee cost of the total cost also registered a decrease. With this Air India has the lowest aircraft-to-employee ratio among all the full service carriers in the country.
While the aircraft-to-employee ratio decreased to 1:114, the employee cost of the total cost decreased by .22% at 11.68% in the financial year 2015 as compared to 12.9% in 2014.
With 133 aircraft in its fleet the National carrier has now 114 employees per aircraft as on 31st March 2015 excluding MRO and Ground Handling subsidiaries as compared to 135 employees per aircraft in the year 2014.
The present aircraft-to-employee ratio (1:114) which is half of what existed in 2012 (1:221) showcases how efficiently and strategically Air India is using its manpower.
